metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20298 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenEXR's B44Compressor. This flaw allows an attacker who can submit a crafted file to be processed by OpenEXR, to exhaust all memory accessible to the application. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20298` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr25 - 2.5.7-1
openexr - 2.5.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.7-1').
